name: PixoPoint Code Comments Plugin
author: PixoPoint Web Development / Ryan Hellyer

sections.description:
Allows your site visitors to post fragments of code in their comments (wrapped in ...) which are automatically encoded instead of them having to convert them to HTML entities such as > and <.

This plugin is based on code posted by Kaspars Dambis on his blog

For more information, please visit our Code Comments blog post.

Live Demo

To see a live demo of the plugin in action, please visit http://pixopoint.com/code-comments/#comment-864.

Credits

Big thanks to Kaspars Dambis who wrote the orignal code for this plugin.
sections.installation:
After you’ve downloaded and extracted the files:

  1. Upload the complete pixopoint-code-comments folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory OR install it via the WordPress plugin repository browser
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
